intro: Syngonanthus allenii var. parvus, commonly known as the small-flowered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils, often in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its flowers are usually pale blue to violet in color and bloom during the summer months. Syngonanthus allenii var. parvus is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
